mention.text: a man whom Sorrow named his friend
he , of his high comrade Sorrow dreaming
the sad dweller by the sea-ways lone
themselves laugh on and sing alway

the man whom Sorrow named his friend Sought once again the shore , and found a shell , And thought , I will my heavy story tell Till my own words , re-echoing , shall send Their sadness through a hollow , pearly heart ; And my own tale again for me shall sing , And my own whispering words be comforting , And lo
